oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Model 1895 Mauser Bayonet
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Bayonet manufactured by Weyersberg, Kirschbaum & Co., which was formed in 1883 by a merger of Weyersberg and Kirschbaum. By 1900, it employed 1200 employees and was the largest company in Solingen. The number K1237 is on the scabbard and C610 on the guard and has wwo unidentified marks on the reverse ricasso. It also has 3 interlocking rings, the stamp for Krupp. This is one of several different styles of bayonets used by the Germans in World War I.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
